data:
1
00:01:53,262 --> 00:01:54,930
Bingo!

2
00:02:09,353 --> 00:02:11,230
Fucking hell.

3
00:02:13,482 --> 00:02:15,443
Fucking hell.

4
00:03:05,576 --> 00:03:08,245
- Oh, God...
- Keep your shit together.

5
00:03:08,329 --> 00:03:11,415
If you wanna get 'em out of here.

6
00:03:12,249 --> 00:03:14,919
- I can pop these, no problem.
- So get to it!

7
00:03:29,141 --> 00:03:31,644
Security, we have a break-in. Get the...

8
00:03:40,111 --> 00:03:42,947
I know who you are.
I know what you think...

9
00:03:43,030 --> 00:03:46,867
If you don't wanna get hurt,
keep your mouth shut and don't move.

10
00:03:46,951 --> 00:03:52,206
The chimps are infected. They're highly
contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.

11
00:03:52,290 --> 00:03:55,751
- Infected with what?
- To cure, you must first understand.

12
00:03:55,835 --> 00:03:58,796
Infected with what?

13
00:04:00,756 --> 00:04:02,633
Rage.

14
00:04:04,343 --> 00:04:07,513
- What is he talking about?
- Get the cages open.

15
00:04:07,596 --> 00:04:08,931
No! No! No!

16
00:04:09,640 --> 00:04:13,936
Listen, you sick bastard,
we're taking your torture victims with us.

17
00:04:14,020 --> 00:04:15,605
We'll get you out of here.

18
00:04:15,688 --> 00:04:20,359
The animals are contagious. The infection
is in their blood and saliva. One bite...

19
00:04:20,443 --> 00:04:22,945
Stop... Stop! You've no idea!

20
00:04:29,493 --> 00:04:32,330
Get it off! Help me!

21
00:04:37,710 --> 00:04:39,837
Get it off! Get it off!

22
00:04:43,466 --> 00:04:46,677
- What's the matter with her?
- You have to kill her!

23
00:04:48,763 --> 00:04:51,015
Oh, my God!

24
00:04:55,353 --> 00:04:58,564
- What's the matter with her?
- We have to kill her now!

25
00:05:01,067 --> 00:05:02,652
Oh, God...

26
00:06:51,636 --> 00:06:53,137
Hello?

27
00:07:31,592 --> 00:07:33,094
Hello?

28
00:07:51,237 --> 00:07:53,239
Hello!

29
00:09:35,174 --> 00:09:36,509
Hello?

30
00:10:02,827 --> 00:10:04,328
Hello!

31
00:14:56,662 --> 00:14:58,748
Hello?

32
00:15:06,756 --> 00:15:08,841
Hello?

33
00:15:23,189 --> 00:15:25,274
Father?

34
00:15:31,697 --> 00:15:33,783
Father, are you OK?

35
00:15:41,123 --> 00:15:43,793
Oh, shouldn't have done that.

36
00:15:44,210 --> 00:15:46,462
Shouldn't have done that.

37
00:15:46,879 --> 00:15:48,756
Shit!

38
00:16:15,533 --> 00:16:17,660
Over here!

39
00:16:20,538 --> 00:16:22,873
- Over here!
- Come on!

40
00:16:35,344 --> 00:16:37,805
Go, go, go!

41
00:16:43,060 --> 00:16:44,145
Keep going!

42
00:16:44,228 --> 00:16:47,106
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just shut up!

43
00:16:55,239 --> 00:16:57,825
- Covered everything.
- Who are those people?

44
00:17:25,144 --> 00:17:26,395
Let's go! Let's go!

45
00:17:26,479 --> 00:17:28,731
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just move!

46
00:17:37,531 --> 00:17:39,533
Come on!

47
00:17:58,719 --> 00:18:03,474
Man walks into a bar with a giraffe.
They each get pissed.

48
00:18:03,557 --> 00:18:05,559
The giraffe falls over.

49
00:18:05,643 --> 00:18:10,856
The man goes to leave and the barman says
"Oi! You can't leave that lying there. "

50
00:18:10,940 --> 00:18:14,986
He says "No, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe".

51
00:18:22,618 --> 00:18:25,496
He's completely humourless.

52
00:18:25,579 --> 00:18:28,499
You two should get on like a house on fire.

53
00:18:30,001 --> 00:18:32,086
So who are you?

54
00:18:33,296 --> 00:18:35,214
You're from the hospital.

55
00:18:35,298 --> 00:18:38,801
- Are you a doctor?
- He's not a doctor. He's a patient.

56
00:18:38,884 --> 00:18:41,220
I'm a bicycle courier.

57
00:18:43,389 --> 00:18:49,812
I was riding a package from Farringdon to
Shaftesbury Avenue and a car cut across me.

58
00:18:49,895 --> 00:18:53,649
Then I wake up today in hospital.
I wake up and I'm...

59
00:18:53,733 --> 00:18:55,651
I'm hallucinating or I'm...

60
00:18:57,320 --> 00:18:59,780
What's your name?

61
00:18:59,864 --> 00:19:01,949
Jim.

62
00:19:02,617 --> 00:19:05,286
I'm Mark. This is Selena.

63
00:19:09,707 --> 00:19:11,375
OK, Jim.

64
00:19:16,589 --> 00:19:19,133
I've got some bad news.

65
00:19:19,216 --> 00:19:25,473
It started as rioting, and right from
the beginning you knew this was different.

66
00:19:25,556 --> 00:19:29,727
Because it was happening
in small villages, market towns.

67
00:19:30,603 --> 00:19:33,356
And then it wasn't on the TV any more.

68
00:19:33,439 --> 00:19:38,152
It was in the street outside.
It was coming through your windows.

69
00:19:38,235 --> 00:19:40,071
It was a virus.

70
00:19:40,154 --> 00:19:41,948
An infection.

71
00:19:42,031 --> 00:19:44,867
You didn't need a doctor to tell you that.

72
00:19:44,951 --> 00:19:47,411
It was the blood.

73
00:19:47,495 --> 00:19:49,997
There was something in the blood.

74
00:19:51,457 --> 00:19:56,420
By the time they tried to evacuate
the cities, it was already too late.

75
00:19:56,504 --> 00:19:59,423
The infection was everywhere.

76
00:19:59,507 --> 00:20:02,009
The army blockades were overrun.

77
00:20:03,552 --> 00:20:06,264
And that's when the exodus started.

78
00:20:07,640 --> 00:20:10,393
The day before broadcasting stopped,

79
00:20:10,476 --> 00:20:14,146
there were reports of Infection
in Paris and New York.

80
00:20:16,524 --> 00:20:19,443
We didn't hear anything more after that.

81
00:20:22,405 --> 00:20:25,366
- What's the government doing?
- There's no government.

82
00:20:25,449 --> 00:20:27,910
Of course there's a government!

83
00:20:27,994 --> 00:20:32,081
There's always a government.
They're in a bunker or a plane...

84
00:20:32,164 --> 00:20:36,460
No, there's no government,
no police, no army.

85
00:20:37,920 --> 00:20:41,007
No TV, no radio, no electricity.

86
00:20:41,632 --> 00:20:45,803
You're the first uninfected person
we've seen in six days.

87
00:20:46,637 --> 00:20:48,723
Where's your family?

88
00:20:49,640 --> 00:20:51,684
They're dead. Like Selena's.

89
00:20:51,767 --> 00:20:53,894
Yours will be dead too.

90
00:21:04,196 --> 00:21:08,200
Look, I have to find them.
They live in Deptford. I can walk it. OK?

91
00:21:08,284 --> 00:21:10,870
You'll go and come back, yeah?

92
00:21:12,830 --> 00:21:15,082
- You won't.
- Yes!

93
00:21:15,166 --> 00:21:18,169
No one ever comes back.

94
00:21:22,673 --> 00:21:24,759
So lesson one.

95
00:21:25,635 --> 00:21:30,056
You never go anywhere alone
unless you've got no choice.

96
00:21:30,139 --> 00:21:32,475
Lesson two.

97
00:21:32,558 --> 00:21:36,646
Only travel during daylight.
Unless you've got no choice.

98
00:21:38,689 --> 00:21:40,733
We'll take you tomorrow.

99
00:21:40,816 --> 00:21:44,403
We'll all go and find
your dead parents together, OK?

100
00:21:45,446 --> 00:21:46,906
Eat.

101
00:21:59,085 --> 00:22:02,254
If you want her to slow down,
you'll have to say.

102
00:22:29,156 --> 00:22:30,825
- If there's anyone...
- I understand.

103
00:22:30,908 --> 00:22:32,994
- Anyone...
- I understand!

104
00:22:35,121 --> 00:22:36,664
OK.

105
00:23:18,456 --> 00:23:19,790
Jim...

106
00:23:20,625 --> 00:23:21,959
Wait!

107
00:24:46,627 --> 00:24:50,589
They died peacefully.
You should be grateful.

108
00:24:50,673 --> 00:24:53,092
I'm not grateful.

109
00:24:54,343 --> 00:24:56,345
My...

110
00:24:57,054 --> 00:25:01,559
parents and my sister,
we went to Paddington Station,

111
00:25:04,186 --> 00:25:09,525
hoping maybe we could get on a plane,
maybe we could buy our way onto a plane.

112
00:25:10,151 --> 00:25:12,528
I remember my dad had all this cash,

113
00:25:12,612 --> 00:25:15,948
even though cash was completely useless.

114
00:25:17,491 --> 00:25:20,620
About 20,000 other people had the same idea.

115
00:25:23,122 --> 00:25:25,333
Crowd was surging.

116
00:25:26,167 --> 00:25:28,502
I lost my grip on my sister's hand.

117
00:25:30,671 --> 00:25:33,007
I remember the ground was soft.

118
00:25:34,967 --> 00:25:39,347
I looked down
and I was standing on all these people.

119
00:25:39,430 --> 00:25:43,392
Like a carpet. People who had fallen and...

120
00:25:43,476 --> 00:25:47,438
Somewhere in the crowd
there were Infected. It spread fast.

121
00:25:47,521 --> 00:25:50,858
No one could run.
All you could do was climb.

122
00:25:52,485 --> 00:25:55,571
Climb over more people.
So I did that. I climbed.

123
00:25:55,655 --> 00:25:58,032
And I got up on top of this kiosk.

124
00:26:00,326 --> 00:26:05,289
Looking down, you couldn't tell
which faces were infected and which weren't.

125
00:26:05,373 --> 00:26:09,251
Then I saw my dad.
Not my mum or my sister.

126
00:26:09,335 --> 00:26:11,295
My dad.

127
00:26:13,589 --> 00:26:15,675
His face...

128
00:26:19,345 --> 00:26:23,266
Selena's right.
You should be grateful.

129
00:26:23,349 --> 00:26:28,521
We don't have time to get back to the shop
before dark. We should stay here tonight.

130
00:26:31,190 --> 00:26:34,026
My room's up at the top.
You two can have that.

131
00:26:34,110 --> 00:26:37,446
No, we'll all sleep in the same room. It's safer.

132
00:27:57,735 --> 00:27:59,820
Jim.

133
00:28:08,496 --> 00:28:10,581
- You're back.
- Yeah.

134
00:28:16,963 --> 00:28:19,048
- How was it?
- Fine.

135
00:28:20,132 --> 00:28:22,426
Give me a drink of that, will ya?

136
00:28:22,510 --> 00:28:24,595
- It's empty.
- Ha!

137
00:28:26,889 --> 00:28:29,225
Here.

138
00:28:31,310 --> 00:28:33,396
I'll start working on them, then.

139
00:28:40,027 --> 00:28:42,029
Mark! Mark!

140
00:28:42,822 --> 00:28:44,949
Selena! Help!

141
00:28:59,297 --> 00:29:01,382
It's clear.

142
00:29:06,846 --> 00:29:09,807
- That's Mr Bridges.
- Were you bitten?

143
00:29:09,890 --> 00:29:12,101
And his daughter. From four doors down.

144
00:29:12,184 --> 00:29:15,271
- Were you bitten?
- No.

145
00:29:15,354 --> 00:29:18,274
Did any of the blood get in your mouth?

146
00:29:19,191 --> 00:29:21,193
No.

147
00:29:24,322 --> 00:29:26,073
Mark?

148
00:29:28,492 --> 00:29:30,202
Wait...

149
00:29:52,058 --> 00:29:54,268
Get that cleaned off.

150
00:29:56,145 --> 00:29:58,230
Do you have any clothes here?

151
00:29:59,357 --> 00:30:01,233
Um... I... Yes.

152
00:30:01,317 --> 00:30:04,987
Then get them and get dressed.
We have to leave now.

153
00:30:05,071 --> 00:30:08,741
More Infected will be coming.
They always do.

154
00:30:37,520 --> 00:30:40,523
How did you know?
How did you know he was infected?

155
00:30:40,606 --> 00:30:44,527
- The blood.
- There was blood on me. It was on you.

156
00:30:44,610 --> 00:30:49,991
I didn't know he was infected.
He knew. I could see it in his face.

157
00:30:50,074 --> 00:30:54,495
If someone gets infected,
you've about 20 seconds to kill them.

158
00:30:54,578 --> 00:30:59,709
It might be your brother, your sister
or your oldest friend. It makes no difference.

159
00:30:59,792 --> 00:31:05,214
Just so you know where you stand,
if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat.

160
00:31:05,298 --> 00:31:09,510
He was full of plans.
Have you got any plans, Jim?

161
00:31:09,594 --> 00:31:14,056
Do you want us to find a cure and
save the world or just fall in love and fuck?

162
00:31:14,140 --> 00:31:16,642
Plans are pointless.

163
00:31:16,726 --> 00:31:19,312
Staying alive's as good as it gets.

164
00:31:21,147 --> 00:31:22,565
Hey, hey, hey, hey.

165
00:31:22,648 --> 00:31:24,734
What's that?

166
00:31:30,823 --> 00:31:32,908
Let's go.

167
00:32:18,037 --> 00:32:21,165
What is it about tower blocks
and shopping trolleys?

168
00:32:21,248 --> 00:32:24,335
Stop talking. It's a long way up.

169
00:32:34,053 --> 00:32:36,389
Do you need a break?

170
00:32:37,598 --> 00:32:39,600
- You?
- No.

171
00:32:42,270 --> 00:32:44,355
Now I do need a break.

172
00:32:54,824 --> 00:32:56,659
What's up?

173
00:32:56,742 --> 00:32:58,744
Nothin'.

174
00:33:01,122 --> 00:33:02,456
I got a headache.

175
00:33:02,540 --> 00:33:04,041
- Bad?
- Pretty bad.

176
00:33:04,125 --> 00:33:09,422
- Why didn't you say something before?
- I didn't think you'd give a shit.

177
00:33:10,631 --> 00:33:14,885
You've got no fat on you
and all you've had to eat is sugar.

178
00:33:14,969 --> 00:33:17,096
So you're crashing.

179
00:33:17,179 --> 00:33:19,432
There isn't a lot we can do about that

180
00:33:19,515 --> 00:33:24,604
except pump you full of painkillers
and give you more sugar. As for sugar,

181
00:33:24,687 --> 00:33:26,981
Pepsi or Lilt?

182
00:33:28,232 --> 00:33:30,234
Do you have any Tango?

183
00:33:30,318 --> 00:33:33,362
Actually,
I did have a can of Tango somewhere.

184
00:33:34,572 --> 00:33:36,824
Quiet! That's an Infected.

185
00:33:47,168 --> 00:33:49,003
Oh no, they're in. Move!

186
00:33:52,089 --> 00:33:54,634
Wait up, Selena!

187
00:33:55,551 --> 00:33:57,553
Wait for me, please!

188
00:33:57,637 --> 00:33:59,764
Please, Selena! Please!

189
00:33:59,847 --> 00:34:02,183
- Wait for me!
- Come on!

190
00:34:02,266 --> 00:34:04,268
- Run!
- Wait!

191
00:34:04,894 --> 00:34:07,605
Please! For fuck's sake!

192
00:34:08,189 --> 00:34:10,441
- Selena!

193
00:34:12,151 --> 00:34:15,529
Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move!

194
00:34:15,613 --> 00:34:17,698
Thank you. Thank you.

195
00:34:30,169 --> 00:34:32,213
Open the door!

196
00:34:37,802 --> 00:34:39,387
Open the door!

197
00:34:44,100 --> 00:34:46,602
- Open up!
- Where's Dad?

198
00:34:46,686 --> 00:34:48,145
What?

199
00:34:50,731 --> 00:34:53,734
- Open the fucking door!
- Where's Dad?

200
00:34:53,818 --> 00:34:56,112
Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside.

201
00:35:04,036 --> 00:35:06,330
Go in. Go in!

202
00:35:24,348 --> 00:35:26,809
So, I'm Frank, anyway.

203
00:35:26,892 --> 00:35:28,686
Jim.

204
00:35:29,520 --> 00:35:32,607
- Selena.
- Selena. Good to meet you.

205
00:35:32,690 --> 00:35:34,984
This is my daughter Hannah.

206
00:35:35,067 --> 00:35:37,320
Come on, sweetheart. Say hello.

207
00:35:38,738 --> 00:35:40,823
Come on.

208
00:35:41,574 --> 00:35:43,534
So...

209
00:35:43,618 --> 00:35:45,536
This is great. Just great.

210
00:35:47,872 --> 00:35:50,166
Calls for a celebration, I'd say.

211
00:35:50,249 --> 00:35:53,294
Why don't you all sit down and...

212
00:35:53,377 --> 00:35:56,339
Hannah, what have we got to offer?

213
00:35:56,422 --> 00:35:58,925
We've got Mum's creme de menthe.

214
00:35:59,008 --> 00:36:01,719
Great. Creme de menthe.

215
00:36:01,802 --> 00:36:04,513
Oh, yeah. Look, sit, please.

216
00:36:04,597 --> 00:36:07,058
Get comfortable.

217
00:36:09,894 --> 00:36:12,897
- Where are the bloody glasses?
- Middle cupboard.

218
00:36:12,980 --> 00:36:15,858
Nah, the good ones. It's a celebration.

219
00:36:15,942 --> 00:36:18,444
Top cupboard.

220
00:36:18,527 --> 00:36:21,238
So this is your place?

221
00:36:22,490 --> 00:36:24,241
It's nice.

222
00:36:37,421 --> 00:36:38,547
There.

223
00:36:38,631 --> 00:36:41,717
I know it isn't much but, well, cheers.

224
00:36:41,801 --> 00:36:43,552
Cheers.

225
00:37:05,074 --> 00:37:07,159
You OK in there, Jim?

226
00:37:08,119 --> 00:37:10,454
Yeah.

227
00:37:10,538 --> 00:37:16,127
Sorry we couldn't spare the water.
Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work.

228
00:37:17,795 --> 00:37:20,047
You'll have to use the bucket.

229
00:37:26,596 --> 00:37:29,223
Have to empty it each morning.

230
00:37:29,307 --> 00:37:32,977
Just chuck it over the balcony.
No mod cons here.

231
00:37:33,060 --> 00:37:34,770
It's fine.

232
00:37:34,854 --> 00:37:37,982
Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in.

233
00:37:39,650 --> 00:37:42,028
We have a spare room.

234
00:37:43,070 --> 00:37:44,363
In there.

235
00:37:44,447 --> 00:37:46,407
Are you and Selena...?

236
00:37:47,658 --> 00:37:49,493
No. No, no, no.

237
00:37:49,577 --> 00:37:51,245
Um...

238
00:37:51,329 --> 00:37:53,706
I'll take the living room. It's fine.

239
00:37:53,789 --> 00:37:55,666
Right.

240
00:37:56,542 --> 00:37:58,628
No, I mean, yeah.

241
00:37:59,670 --> 00:38:01,672
So, um...

242
00:38:02,715 --> 00:38:05,718
- Goodnight, then.
- Yeah. Goodnight, Frank.

243
00:38:20,358 --> 00:38:21,901
Very spruce.

244
00:38:23,235 --> 00:38:26,072
- Very shredded.
- Yeah.

245
00:38:30,409 --> 00:38:34,121
- So what do you make of them?
- Well, they're desperate.

246
00:38:35,247 --> 00:38:38,084
Probably need us more than we need them.

247
00:38:39,543 --> 00:38:41,796
I think they're good people.

248
00:38:44,632 --> 00:38:47,593
- Good people?
- Yeah.

249
00:38:49,387 --> 00:38:54,058
You should be more concerned about
whether they're gonna slow you down.

250
00:38:54,141 --> 00:38:57,895
- Because if they slowed you down...
- I'd leave them behind.

251
00:38:57,979 --> 00:38:59,897
- In a heartbeat.
- Yeah.

252
00:39:00,606 --> 00:39:02,275
I wouldn't.

253
00:39:02,358 --> 00:39:05,903
Then you're gonna wind up
getting yourself killed.

254
00:39:14,245 --> 00:39:16,747
I'm gonna get some sleep.

255
00:39:19,250 --> 00:39:21,127
Selena...

256
00:39:21,961 --> 00:39:25,214
You think I don't get it, but I do get it.

257
00:39:27,091 --> 00:39:31,095
And I know I'd be dead already
if I hadn't met you.

258
00:39:31,596 --> 00:39:33,180
Sure.

259
00:39:33,264 --> 00:39:34,849
No, look...

260
00:39:37,226 --> 00:39:39,312
I mean, thank you.

261
00:39:42,481 --> 00:39:44,650
And I mean, sure.

262
00:39:44,734 --> 00:39:47,528
Goodnight, Jim.

263
00:39:47,612 --> 00:39:49,697
Goodnight.

264
00:40:03,294 --> 00:40:05,379
We lost water pressure three weeks ago.

265
00:40:05,463 --> 00:40:09,592
I thought we'd be OK with the water
from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks.

266
00:40:09,675 --> 00:40:12,887
But it vanishes so quick
you wouldn't believe.

267
00:40:16,182 --> 00:40:17,892
You drink it,

268
00:40:17,975 --> 00:40:19,769
it evaporates,

269
00:40:19,852 --> 00:40:21,938
turns stagnant.

270
00:40:24,315 --> 00:40:26,400
They're all empty.

271
00:40:27,276 --> 00:40:29,278
Hasn't rained in ten days.

272
00:40:29,362 --> 00:40:33,616
You can set up a plastic sheet
to catch dew and condensation.

273
00:40:33,699 --> 00:40:37,453
Saw it on TV once, but I can't make it work.

274
00:40:38,788 --> 00:40:40,873
You'd never think it.

275
00:40:41,791 --> 00:40:44,752
Needing rain so badly.

276
00:40:46,420 --> 00:40:48,839
Not in fucking England!

277
00:40:53,511 --> 00:40:56,639
Jim, we're not going to be able to stay here.

278
00:41:05,564 --> 00:41:09,318
- There's been no broadcasts for weeks.
- Just listen.

279
00:41:09,402 --> 00:41:13,990
Salvation is here.
The answer to Infection is here.

280
00:41:14,073 --> 00:41:17,076
if you can hear this, you're not alone.

281
00:41:17,159 --> 00:41:21,664
There are others like you.
There are other survivors.

282
00:41:21,747 --> 00:41:23,958
We are soldiers and we are armed.

283
00:41:24,041 --> 00:41:27,336
Oh, my God. Soldiers.

284
00:41:27,420 --> 00:41:32,008
- Quiet. There's more.
- Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602,

285
00:41:32,091 --> 00:41:35,511
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

286
00:41:35,595 --> 00:41:39,515
- You must find us. Salvation is...
- Now it just repeats.

287
00:41:39,599 --> 00:41:41,976
- It's a recording?
- Yeah, it's a recording.

288
00:41:42,059 --> 00:41:44,979
But this is where it's telling us to go.

289
00:41:45,062 --> 00:41:47,231
Just there.

290
00:41:48,733 --> 00:41:53,529
The way things are, we might need
two or three days to get up there.

291
00:41:53,613 --> 00:41:55,323
"We"?

292
00:41:59,410 --> 00:42:05,499
Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah
do need you more than you need us.

293
00:42:05,583 --> 00:42:08,753
- Look, I didn't...
- No, it's OK. It's the truth.

294
00:42:08,836 --> 00:42:11,339
I can't leave the block if it's the two of us.

295
00:42:11,422 --> 00:42:15,384
Something might happen to me.
Hannah'd be alone. I couldn't risk it.

296
00:42:15,468 --> 00:42:17,178
But with other people...

297
00:42:17,261 --> 00:42:21,557
If it's a recording,
the soldiers who made it could be dead.

298
00:42:21,641 --> 00:42:25,144
- It's possible.
- That stuff about the answer to Infection...

299
00:42:25,227 --> 00:42:29,523
There is no answer!
It's already done all the damage it can!

300
00:42:29,607 --> 00:42:32,443
- Maybe they have a cure.
- Maybe they've got nothing.

301
00:42:32,526 --> 00:42:36,614
- The only way to find out is to reach them.
- We could die trying, Frank!

302
00:42:38,699 --> 00:42:40,993
Or die here.

303
00:42:41,077 --> 00:42:46,791
And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said.
You need us just the same as we need you.

304
00:42:48,292 --> 00:42:50,169
We need each other.

305
00:42:50,253 --> 00:42:55,549
And we'll never be safe in the cities.
The soldiers could keep us safe.

306
00:42:56,259 --> 00:42:58,344
So we have to try and get there.

307
00:42:59,470 --> 00:43:01,055
Get there how?

308
00:43:12,483 --> 00:43:16,237
Just so you know,
I don't take cheques or credit cards.

309
00:43:44,807 --> 00:43:47,810
- What do you think?
- It's the most direct route.

310
00:43:47,893 --> 00:43:53,149
Then we should take the indirect route.
The one in daylight and not underground.

311
00:43:53,232 --> 00:43:55,568
Let's just get it done.

312
00:44:08,497 --> 00:44:10,666
No, no.

313
00:44:10,750 --> 00:44:13,252
No. See, this is a really shit idea.

314
00:44:14,128 --> 00:44:17,506
You know why?
Because it's obviously a shit idea.

315
00:44:17,590 --> 00:44:21,969
So we're gonna drive into the tunnel
full of fucking smashed cars...

316
00:44:22,053 --> 00:44:24,972
It's really fucking obviously a shit idea!

317
00:44:25,056 --> 00:44:27,308
Hold on!

318
00:44:36,484 --> 00:44:38,361
Dad!

319
00:44:57,797 --> 00:44:59,340
Fuck!

320
00:45:00,633 --> 00:45:03,052
The world's worst place to get a flat.

321
00:45:03,135 --> 00:45:06,472
Agreed. I think we'd better do this quick.

322
00:45:08,975 --> 00:45:11,143
I've got the wheel. You're on the jack.

323
00:45:25,741 --> 00:45:29,287
Do you hear that?
Hey, hey, do you hear that?

324
00:45:29,370 --> 00:45:31,455
Hear what?

325
00:45:32,123 --> 00:45:34,417
Right, I've done it.

326
00:45:36,002 --> 00:45:37,461
Dad?

327
00:45:41,340 --> 00:45:44,427
- Jesus Christ!

328
00:45:44,510 --> 00:45:46,053
Fucking rats!

329
00:45:56,606 --> 00:45:59,191
They're running from the Infected.

330
00:45:59,275 --> 00:46:01,193
Move it!

331
00:46:01,277 --> 00:46:05,573
Forget the jack, Hannah.
There's no time. Just lift, everyone.

332
00:46:05,656 --> 00:46:08,909
Grab hold! One, two, three, lift!

333
00:46:12,872 --> 00:46:14,832
Lift, lift!

334
00:46:15,374 --> 00:46:20,504
- Don't look at them! Don't look!
- I can see them! They're coming!

335
00:46:26,218 --> 00:46:28,804
Come on, Hannah!

336
00:46:28,888 --> 00:46:31,307
Almost.

337
00:46:31,390 --> 00:46:34,310
- Get the tyre on, Hannah!
- I'm trying.

338
00:46:39,106 --> 00:46:41,776
Three, two, one,

339
00:46:41,859 --> 00:46:43,569
drop it!

340
00:46:47,698 --> 00:46:50,159
- Get in the car!
- Come on!

341
00:46:52,244 --> 00:46:54,622
- Frank, drive!
- Move it, Frank!

342
00:46:57,541 --> 00:46:59,627
Whoo!

343
00:47:04,423 --> 00:47:06,509
Goodbye, you fuckers!

344
00:47:14,475 --> 00:47:16,769
Frank, stop the cab.

345
00:47:39,750 --> 00:47:42,044
Let's shop.

346
00:47:52,680 --> 00:47:54,181
You...

347
00:47:54,974 --> 00:47:56,475
You...

348
00:47:57,310 --> 00:47:58,394
You...

349
00:47:58,477 --> 00:48:01,063
Anybody seen any buns?

350
00:48:01,147 --> 00:48:03,941
Hmm. Irradiated.

351
00:48:06,652 --> 00:48:10,239
Don't take anything
that needs to be cooked, OK?

352
00:48:10,323 --> 00:48:12,158
I think you can eat that raw.

353
00:48:12,241 --> 00:48:14,118
Decaffeinated coffee...

354
00:48:14,201 --> 00:48:16,287
Put that back.

355
00:48:17,496 --> 00:48:19,749
CanÂ’t just take any crap.

356
00:48:19,832 --> 00:48:24,337
If I never see another chocolate bar again,
it'll be too soon.

357
00:48:24,754 --> 00:48:27,423
Not counting Terry's Chocolate Orange!

358
00:48:29,050 --> 00:48:32,678
Now, single malt,
16-year-old, dark, full flavour.

359
00:48:33,638 --> 00:48:35,598
Warm but not aggressive.

360
00:48:35,681 --> 00:48:39,185
- Peaty aftertaste.

361
00:48:40,770 --> 00:48:44,023
Takes out the fire but leaves in the warmth.

362
00:49:38,911 --> 00:49:41,998
Either we do this now or we're walking.

363
00:49:49,005 --> 00:49:51,090
Not you.

364
00:49:54,427 --> 00:49:56,721
- Stay close, Jim.
- What?

365
00:49:56,804 --> 00:49:58,889
You heard.

366
00:50:25,458 --> 00:50:27,543
Where are you going?

367
00:50:28,628 --> 00:50:31,047
We've got enough food, Jim.

368
00:50:31,130 --> 00:50:33,466
We don't have any cheeseburgers.

369
00:50:34,216 --> 00:50:36,886
Like going on holidays
with your aunt!

370
00:51:16,092 --> 00:51:18,552
Oh, Jesus.

371
00:51:44,370 --> 00:51:45,913
Hello?

372
00:51:59,719 --> 00:52:01,512
I hate you!

373
00:52:10,688 --> 00:52:12,773
Find anything?

374
00:52:15,026 --> 00:52:17,820
- Find anything, Jim?
- No! Let's get outta here.

375
00:52:17,903 --> 00:52:19,989
OK, we're done here.

376
00:52:22,199 --> 00:52:24,076
OK, Hannah.

377
00:52:31,459 --> 00:52:33,127
Easy. Brake!

378
00:52:33,210 --> 00:52:35,296
Brake, brake!

379
00:52:43,137 --> 00:52:45,222
Out.

380
00:53:29,809 --> 00:53:33,020
Mmmm! Oh my God!

381
00:53:33,771 --> 00:53:36,774
I can, like, taste the vitamin C.

382
00:53:37,608 --> 00:53:40,403
Mmmm, the raisins are so moist.

383
00:53:41,612 --> 00:53:43,698
What did you say?

384
00:53:43,781 --> 00:53:46,575
The raisins. They're so moist.

385
00:53:51,330 --> 00:53:53,416
Look over here.

386
00:54:04,719 --> 00:54:06,554
Like a family.

387
00:54:06,637 --> 00:54:09,098
Do you think they're infected?

388
00:54:09,515 --> 00:54:11,601
No.

389
00:54:15,062 --> 00:54:17,773
They're doing just fine.

390
00:54:23,529 --> 00:54:25,615
Come on. Let's eat!

391
00:54:40,296 --> 00:54:41,631
Know what I was thinking?

392
00:54:41,714 --> 00:54:45,426
That you'll never hear
another piece of original music again.

393
00:54:45,509 --> 00:54:49,680
You'll never read a book
that hasn't already been written,

394
00:54:50,723 --> 00:54:54,560
or see a film that hasn't already been shot.

395
00:54:59,065 --> 00:55:02,318
Um... that's what you were thinking.

396
00:55:02,401 --> 00:55:04,278
No.

397
00:55:05,529 --> 00:55:07,823
I was thinking I was wrong.

398
00:55:09,075 --> 00:55:11,160
About what?

399
00:55:12,870 --> 00:55:14,956
All the death.

400
00:55:15,539 --> 00:55:17,625
All this shit.

401
00:55:19,252 --> 00:55:23,756
It doesn't really mean anything
to Frank and Hannah because...

402
00:55:25,132 --> 00:55:28,594
Well, she's got her dad
and he's got his daughter. So...

403
00:55:28,678 --> 00:55:30,805
Cheeky monkey!

404
00:55:31,264 --> 00:55:34,892
I was wrong when I said
staying alive is as good as it gets.

405
00:55:38,521 --> 00:55:41,023
See, that's what I was thinking.

406
00:55:41,524 --> 00:55:43,192
Was it?

407
00:55:43,276 --> 00:55:45,569
Mm. You stole my thought.

408
00:55:50,783 --> 00:55:52,660
Sorry.

409
00:55:53,619 --> 00:55:55,496
That's OK.

410
00:55:55,580 --> 00:55:57,665
You can keep it.

411
00:55:58,791 --> 00:56:02,795
It's getting late.
We'd better stay here for the night.

412
00:56:17,852 --> 00:56:20,396
I can't sleep.

413
00:56:20,479 --> 00:56:23,107
Me neither.

414
00:56:23,190 --> 00:56:25,568
Doesn't feel safe, does it?

415
00:56:25,651 --> 00:56:27,737
Outside like this.

416
00:56:28,613 --> 00:56:31,032
I think we're safe enough.

417
00:56:31,115 --> 00:56:33,784
Selena didn't seem to have any trouble.

418
00:56:34,493 --> 00:56:36,996
Yeah, I noticed that.

419
00:56:37,079 --> 00:56:38,581
Hey, Selena...

420
00:56:38,664 --> 00:56:40,750
What? What is it?

421
00:56:42,084 --> 00:56:44,128
How'd you get to sleep?

422
00:56:50,593 --> 00:56:54,472
Bloody hell. Must've needed
a hell of a prescription for that lot.

423
00:56:54,555 --> 00:56:58,851
I didn't need a prescription.
I qualified as a chemist.

424
00:56:58,935 --> 00:57:01,479
Oh, great. Valium.

425
00:57:01,562 --> 00:57:04,148
Not only will we be able to get to sleep

426
00:57:04,231 --> 00:57:07,944
but if we're attacked in the middle
of the night, we won't even care.

427
00:57:08,027 --> 00:57:10,279
- Two each.
- Not for me, thanks.

428
00:57:10,363 --> 00:57:12,406
Can I, Dad?

429
00:57:12,490 --> 00:57:14,492
I don't think so, sweetheart.

430
00:57:14,575 --> 00:57:16,077
Please?

431
00:57:17,578 --> 00:57:19,664
- No.
- I can't sleep.

432
00:57:22,750 --> 00:57:25,461
Come on, Frank. Let her live a little.

433
00:57:26,545 --> 00:57:30,549
- Give her half of one.
- All right. We're on.

434
00:57:41,227 --> 00:57:43,187
Night-night.

435
00:57:43,980 --> 00:57:46,607
You're a big softie, Frank.

436
00:58:17,221 --> 00:58:19,181
Frank?

437
00:58:19,265 --> 00:58:21,350
Hannah?

438
00:58:21,434 --> 00:58:23,311
Frank?

439
00:58:28,941 --> 00:58:31,027
Hello? Hello!

440
00:58:32,069 --> 00:58:33,321
Hello!

441
00:58:33,404 --> 00:58:35,906
Hello! Hello!

442
00:58:43,998 --> 00:58:46,083
Shh...

443
00:58:47,460 --> 00:58:50,254
You're having a bad dream, that's all.

444
00:58:53,007 --> 00:58:55,092
Thanks, Dad.

445
00:59:30,378 --> 00:59:32,964
Come on, sleepyhead.

446
00:59:36,634 --> 00:59:38,719
Come on, Babe Ruth.

447
00:59:41,931 --> 00:59:43,808
Hurry up.

448
00:59:45,559 --> 00:59:49,063
- Did I miss breakfast?
- You'll sleep through anything.

449
00:59:49,146 --> 00:59:54,151
- Did you have a fry-up?
- We'll stop at a pub on the way. Door!

450
01:00:18,718 --> 01:00:23,222
Our location is the
42nd blockade, the M602,

451
01:00:23,306 --> 01:00:26,392
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

452
01:00:26,475 --> 01:00:28,394
You must find us. Please!

453
01:00:28,477 --> 01:00:30,605
Salvation is here.

454
01:00:30,688 --> 01:00:33,733
The answer to Infection is here.

455
01:01:05,765 --> 01:01:07,850
Must be Manchester.

456
01:01:10,061 --> 01:01:13,439
The whole of Manchester, the whole city.

457
01:01:15,274 --> 01:01:17,610
No fire crews to put it out.

458
01:02:12,415 --> 01:02:15,001
42nd blockade.

459
01:02:15,084 --> 01:02:17,420
This is it.

460
01:03:28,574 --> 01:03:32,578
I don't understand, Dad.
Did they leave?

461
01:03:32,662 --> 01:03:35,790
- I don't like this. I think we should go.
- No!

462
01:03:42,630 --> 01:03:47,468
Vehicles. We should check the vehicles.
There has to be something.

463
01:04:05,611 --> 01:04:07,530
Nothing.

464
01:04:07,613 --> 01:04:09,532
I can't believe it.

465
01:04:09,615 --> 01:04:11,576
Frank...

466
01:04:12,034 --> 01:04:13,911
Frank!

467
01:04:16,122 --> 01:04:17,790
- We have to go.
- Yeah.

468
01:04:17,873 --> 01:04:20,376
Go fucking where?!

469
01:04:59,498 --> 01:05:01,667
Get out of it.

470
01:05:05,171 --> 01:05:07,256
Get out of it!

471
01:05:25,066 --> 01:05:27,652
Dad, are you all right?

472
01:05:27,735 --> 01:05:30,404
Yeah, I'm fine, sweetheart.

473
01:05:31,322 --> 01:05:34,033
Sorry I lost my temper.

474
01:05:34,116 --> 01:05:36,244
Hannah...

475
01:05:36,327 --> 01:05:39,288
I love you very much.

476
01:05:39,372 --> 01:05:41,374
- What?
- Keep away from me.

477
01:05:41,457 --> 01:05:43,793
Stay where you are.

478
01:05:43,876 --> 01:05:46,796
- Dad?
- Keep away from me! Keep away from me!

479
01:05:46,879 --> 01:05:49,382
Keep away! Keep away! Keep away!

480
01:05:49,465 --> 01:05:52,593
- Dad!
- Keep away! Keep away!

481
01:05:54,095 --> 01:05:56,847
What's wrong? Dad!

482
01:06:01,143 --> 01:06:03,562
Jim! Jim, he's infected!

483
01:06:03,646 --> 01:06:06,274
- No!
- Now, Jim! Now!

484
01:06:06,357 --> 01:06:09,777
- Jim, kill him! Jim!
- Dad!

485
01:06:09,860 --> 01:06:11,153
Kill him!

486
01:06:19,620 --> 01:06:21,914
Stay away from him!

487
01:06:23,165 --> 01:06:25,585
Keep away from the body!

488
01:06:28,337 --> 01:06:30,214
Dad?

489
01:06:52,612 --> 01:06:55,281
Three survivors. One male, two female.

490
01:06:55,364 --> 01:06:58,701
I repeat, one male, two female.

491
01:06:58,784 --> 01:07:01,370
ETA, 15.

492
01:07:01,454 --> 01:07:03,915
Put the kettle on.

493
01:07:51,879 --> 01:07:54,382
I'm Major Henry West.

494
01:07:55,633 --> 01:07:57,343
- Welcome.
- Jim.

495
01:07:57,426 --> 01:07:59,428
Hello, Jim.

496
01:07:59,512 --> 01:08:01,264
Hello.

497
01:08:03,516 --> 01:08:08,396
Well, we've got beds with clean sheets
and a boiler that produces hot water.

498
01:08:08,479 --> 01:08:10,898
So you can all have a shower.

499
01:08:10,982 --> 01:08:14,318
You look like you need one. Please.

500
01:08:34,255 --> 01:08:39,468
It ain't funny. I got loads of cooking to do,
you fucking Doris!

501
01:08:40,553 --> 01:08:42,680
Run him over!

502
01:08:45,391 --> 01:08:48,185
How is she doing?

503
01:08:48,269 --> 01:08:51,439
She's lost her dad, Jim. That's how she is.

504
01:08:54,108 --> 01:08:56,611
It's all fucked.

505
01:08:56,694 --> 01:08:58,696
What do you mean?

506
01:09:03,743 --> 01:09:07,330
Oh, don't do that.
Come on, come on, come on.

507
01:09:07,413 --> 01:09:09,498
Hey, don't do that.

508
01:09:11,167 --> 01:09:16,172
Hannah is what Frank says she is. Tough,
strong, and she'll cope just like I'll cope.

509
01:09:16,255 --> 01:09:20,176
- Just like you'll cope.
- I don't want her to have to fucking cope.

510
01:09:21,469 --> 01:09:23,888
I want her to be OK.

511
01:09:25,473 --> 01:09:27,642
When Hannah had her dad it was OK.

512
01:09:27,725 --> 01:09:30,519
It was OK for them and it was OK for us.

513
01:09:33,856 --> 01:09:36,275
Now it's all just fucked.

514
01:10:07,723 --> 01:10:10,559
So you heard our broadcast?

515
01:10:10,643 --> 01:10:14,146
- Yeah, we did.
- We must be a disappointment.

516
01:10:14,230 --> 01:10:20,361
You were hoping for a full brigade. An army
base with helicopters and a field hospital.

517
01:10:22,780 --> 01:10:26,951
- We were just hoping for...
- The answer to Infection.

518
01:10:29,287 --> 01:10:31,372
Yeah.

519
01:10:31,455 --> 01:10:35,960
As I said before, it's here. Though
it may not be quite what you imagined.

520
01:10:36,335 --> 01:10:39,255
- Just feel lucky to have found you.
- You were lucky.

521
01:10:39,338 --> 01:10:42,466
The fire drove hundreds of Infected
out of Manchester.

522
01:10:42,550 --> 01:10:45,636
The surrounding area's teeming with them.

523

01:38:27,673 --> 01:38:29,759
- Sir...
- Shh.

776
01:38:33,429 --> 01:38:35,514
Shh.

777
01:38:58,788 --> 01:39:00,873
Hannah?

778
01:39:48,588 --> 01:39:50,673
Hannah?

779
01:39:50,756 --> 01:39:52,258
Selena?

780
01:40:03,394 --> 01:40:07,773
I haven't got any bullets.
I haven't got any fucking bullets!

781
01:40:12,236 --> 01:40:14,906
Don't fucking leave me!

782
01:41:00,034 --> 01:41:01,786
Come on!

783
01:41:03,746 --> 01:41:05,790
Move!

784
01:41:05,873 --> 01:41:08,501
Move! Move!

785
01:41:11,170 --> 01:41:15,967
It's just you and me now, darlin'.
But don't worry, I'll get you out of here.

786
01:41:16,050 --> 01:41:20,513
Then we'll find a nice little fucking place
somewhere. Just you and me.

787
01:41:20,596 --> 01:41:22,932
And we'll live happy ever after, eh?

788
01:42:27,288 --> 01:42:29,790
That was longer than a heartbeat.

789
01:42:32,627 --> 01:42:34,712
Jim?

790
01:42:44,055 --> 01:42:47,600
Listen. Listen. It's not all fucked.

791
01:42:53,356 --> 01:42:55,858
We're gonna be OK. It's not all fucked.

792
01:42:55,942 --> 01:42:59,278
- I've got to explain something.
- Shut up.

793
01:43:00,029 --> 01:43:02,323
It's gonna be OK.

794
01:43:07,787 --> 01:43:11,374
Hannah, it's OK! He's not infected.

795
01:43:11,457 --> 01:43:13,542
But I thought he was biting you.

796
01:43:13,626 --> 01:43:16,295
I was kissing her. Are you stoned?

797
01:43:16,379 --> 01:43:18,547
- It's a long story.

798
01:43:18,631 --> 01:43:20,758
We have to get out of here. Come on!

799
01:43:23,552 --> 01:43:25,638
Come on! Move!

800
01:43:32,645 --> 01:43:34,814
You killed all my boys.

801
01:43:34,897 --> 01:43:36,566
Wait...

802
01:43:43,948 --> 01:43:45,449
Hannah!

803
01:43:45,533 --> 01:43:47,159
Hannah? Hannah!

804
01:43:48,828 --> 01:43:51,038
Hannah!

805
01:44:07,179 --> 01:44:08,764
Get in.

806
01:44:27,742 --> 01:44:29,535
They're locked.

807
01:44:29,619 --> 01:44:32,038
The gates are locked!

808
01:44:34,665 --> 01:44:36,751
Fucking do it!

809
01:44:59,065 --> 01:45:01,484
Come on, Jim, breathe! Fucking breathe!

810
01:45:22,255 --> 01:45:24,548
Not the curtains as well.

811
01:46:35,202 --> 01:46:37,872
You looked all right in this, you know.

812
01:46:39,081 --> 01:46:40,583
It's coming!

813
01:46:57,266 --> 01:46:59,435
- You definitely heard it?
- Yeah!

814
01:46:59,518 --> 01:47:02,855
- I can't hear anything!
- I told you, I heard it!

815
01:47:23,334 --> 01:47:25,169
Go.

816
01:47:58,327 --> 01:48:01,247
Do you think he saw us this time?
